website_summaries.verdict: For the small percentage of you with 802.11ad clients in your home, the Talon AD7200 is a good futureproofing purchase, but is otherwise not worth your money.
pros: The Talon AD7200 features 802.11ad Wi-Fi and can deliver extremely fast speed to devices that support its high-end tech
It works with all current devices albeit at a lower speed
cons: Currently there are few devices that can take advantage of its super-fast speed

customer_reviews.title: End of Life in under 2 year is a fricking joke! Tp-Link, you should be issuing refunds for this sham!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Netgear Nighthawk AC3200 to the AD7200, I appreciated the increase in reliable speed. Occasional dropout maybe once a month, no big deal. A few months go by from my purchase and I see this is now an "End of LIfe" product which will receive no further updates? Why did I even bother spending my money on this router if its not going to have support? What a joke for a company to put out a product and less than 2 years later make it end of life. Stay away from this company! Will be going back to Netgear or Asus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bit the bullet and bought this high price device rather than waste more money on extenders that don't work
customer_reviews.text: Have always had problems with my wireless in certain rooms in my house. Tried multiple routers and range extenders- all of which were awful. Bit the bullet and bought this high price device rather than waste more money on extenders that don't work. After about 2 months of owing it I have no regrets. Worth the price purely for the ability to have a strong internet connection in very room of my house and outside. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CGAR

customer_reviews.title: No firmware updates
customer_reviews.text: Good performance on this router and great user interface. However, no firmware upgrades have been released for this router since January 2017. Several incidents about routers been hacked and vulnerabilities were announced last year and nothing was released about this router by TP-Link nor firmware updates released to address possibly vulnerabilities. This seems to be TP-Link MO, since many routers are in the same situation with outdated firmware. Just keep in mind if you care about your internet security.
customer_reviews.author: prdmshrl

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, just not great.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this router, however, the clunky interface, lack of VPN (other than server) and MU-MIMO (still coming?) makes it hard to rate this higher. The QOS, if you want to call it that only allows you to point it towards devices, unlike others that prioritize types of traffic. The interface doesn't show the devices when monitoring traffic, only IP addresses, which if you are monitoring your kids habits makes you go and check the IP address in another location. Hopefully with updates they will fix these issues, however, I feel like this was released before it was finished.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great Router, but very few 60GHz adapters.
customer_reviews.text: I used a buffalo hi-power and kept having issues where the router would just stop responding. This little ditty works well! Granted I cannot find any adapters that support WiGig, yet, but I guess it is like the 802.11 draft-n where we'll get them when we get them. I would suggest that if you have other routers in the house, that you choose your own channels. When I let this router autodetect my channels, it chose overlapping channels, and I had connection issues. When I changed the channels manually, those issues were resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Failure prone piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Loves to drop all SIDS, has terrible throughput until you recycle it, and TPLInk would stand by their warranty claiming you just need to adjust channel number and bandwidth. Support is slow and wastes your time on issues that presume there isnt a hardware failure. A $300 routers should last for years. not 2 years and a week. Piece of junk. worse support. Spend your $$ on another vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router. Switched from an Asus AC3100 (RT-88U) which ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Router. Switched from an Asus AC3100 (RT-88U) which had good speed but it would not play nice with my connected house. I have 32 devices Sonos, Nest, Smoke Detectors, Lights, Etc and the Asus struggled with dropped connections. Bought this one and I am getting 432mb/25 across my house. Did the set up on my iphone and used the same SSID's and everything magically worked!!
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: ... wifi ever and fastest to be thrown in the garbage due to very poor firmware support
customer_reviews.text: Fastest wifi ever and fastest to be thrown in the garbage due to very poor firmware support. Latest firmware posted for this device by the manufacturer was end of 2015 beginning of 2016. No dd-wrt support. Can be hacked with one click using well known vulnerabilities. You might as well post a sign outside your house that reads "free access to my internet bandwidth and all of my data."
customer_reviews.author: Samee S.

customer_reviews.title: Look else where! Too Expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: You pay for Bells and Whistles. You will almost never use the 90GHZ wifi on this router so that is a waste. The other wifi works as expected. If I had to buy another one I would get the Google WIFI or Multi Room Wifi. The software layout in the router is bad too. Its hard to see a list of IPs and MAC address or to make them static, or to port forward. Would have been nice if I could put DD-WRT on this but its not supported.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth spending, not much connecting devices in the market on the highest speed frequency (60Gz) yet
customer_reviews.text: Not worth spending this much money. My AC1900 works better range for same frequency (2.4 and 5Gz) Be aware that there is not much 60Gz receiving cards/devices/laptops yet in the market. Also, remember, 2.4Gz gives the largest range, next comes 5Gz, and 60Gz range is very small. Router management software needs improvement, not many options. Net net, I felt if it is worth investing on this device for now.
customer_reviews.author: Lightofgrace

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a while, now after a few months I have a intermittent signal which is annoying to say the least. I had to turn the wifi off on my computer and back on to reconnect while I was writing this review. Happens 6 times an hour or more. Needless to say I'm in the market for something reliable, this product doesn't work as well as routers under $100. Can't wait to throw this thing in the garbage and get back into the 21st century. I would rather have a dial up modem at this point.
customer_reviews.author: J T B

customer_reviews.title: The only reliable thing is it’s ability to drop connections.
customer_reviews.text: This router is great when it works, which is about 30 minutes at a time. Speeds are fast and it covers my entire house. That’s why it got the extra star. However, it drops connection with all components on a regular basis. For my desktop (5 ghz) I have to disconnect and reconnect every 30 minutes. For my Fire TV (2.4 ghz), it loses connection every few hours. My phone (2.4 ghz) drops every few hours. My laptop (5 ghz) is fairly consistent, but it still drops at least once a day. Same with my tablet. Do yourself a favor and don’t waste your money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: R. I. P. my old Apple Airport ...
customer_reviews.text: R.I.P. my old Apple Airport Extreme. You have been replaced by this easy-to-setup, BLAZING fast router. On the last day of my Apple router's life, she was only downloading at approx. 3mbps. New router is downloading at approx. 70mbps. Setup took ~10 minutes. Instructions simple to follow.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great router, I just wish it had a more ...
customer_reviews.text: Great router, I just wish it had a more functional interface. The interface is very basic and there is no indicator if the router is actually connected to the internet via the interface. For the price you would think the interface would be way more functional. I am used to utilizing ASUS routers and they are light years ahead of TP-link for functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Rh5150

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away !!!
customer_reviews.text: Really has some issues. Stops routing through LAN ports, needs reboot 2 times a week. Very disappointed for the price and the hype. Tech support is useless.
customer_reviews.author: RWells

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely easy to setup with well thought out instructions (Excellent pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: It was extremely easy to setup with well thought out instructions (Excellent pictures as well). Once the device was configured and running the wireless strength was strong throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P Beard

customer_reviews.title: Good router but needs two updates.
customer_reviews.text: The Router was easy to setup no issues. I only have two complaints/request. 1. I would like to see the option of accessing administration page via https. The router only allows you to access admin page via http which is not secure. 2. I would like to see an option for client isolation (prevent other clients from seeing each other) on the 2.4 Ghz and 5 Ghz radios. This option is only available on the guest wireless page option. Currently, I connect to the guest SSID because this feature makes it bit more secure.
customer_reviews.author: wetfish1

customer_reviews.title: Super fast. uses MIMO technology
customer_reviews.text: Super fast. uses MIMO technology. I had to apply a patch to fix this. The 'Check for Firmware' in the 'System' menu did not detect a newer version. Apparently, the router drops WIFI connections frequently. After googling the issue found that there was a fix on the TP Link website to fix it. It now works great. NOTE: The range is OK it's not the best router range that I've owned. BTW -- I own[ed] over 6 different top-of-the-line routers in the past 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not impressed, very unstable
customer_reviews.text: i had nothing but problems with this router, i had to factory reset it several times in the 2 weeks i had it. i updated firmware and still problems, returned and purchased netgear nighthawk blows this away hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Chevydust

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but now end of life without a model upgrade?
customer_reviews.text: Why has this product already reached end of life? Without a replacement model? Causes me great concern, especially for the money I spent to "future proof" my network...
customer_reviews.author: Epimetheus

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product if you use Alexa to control smart home devices
customer_reviews.text: This product definitely provides better and faster wifi coverage in my house than the router provided by Verizon FIOS. The problem is that Alexa stopped working with all but two of my smart home devices. Neither Amazon nor TP-Link have provided any useful help. I am going to return this product and buy a different router.
customer_reviews.author: James Kannengieser

customer_reviews.title: This is an 'end of life product'.
customer_reviews.text: Had to RMA it and was told the following: "Your AD7200 is an end of life product, and we longer have stock of your product.". Was replaced with Archer C5400. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Just another IT guy

customer_reviews.title: I had several problems trying to set this up to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had several problems trying to set this up to work on my network. Finally gave up and returned as I don't have time to spend days with tech support to get something working that has minimal instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Shep

customer_reviews.title: Great day one!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got this router and saved $200 over the Netgear equivalent. Seems like the Netgear one was too overpriced and did pretty much the same thing. First time using a TP Link router. So far so good on day one. Set up was a bit odd. Kinda glitchy when trying to input the names of the network. Not enough to give it 4 stars. A firmware update to fix some small systems glitches would be great TP Link!
customer_reviews.author: ceilthegreat

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy again
customer_reviews.text: Was a vey good product until they stopped firmware support. No email to let me know had to find out the hard way. I will never buy a product from them again. Would have gave zero stars but had give a one
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Assume!!
customer_reviews.text: For the last two years I've been having problems with my signal dropping out. I got this router after checking reviews and it is GREAT! Never a dropped signal now.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Avoid TP Link products
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router I have ever wasted money on. I feel robbed honestly. This router keeps dropping signals to my phone and my smart tv. I can't watch Hulu or Netflix due to it being a piece of junk. I had a nighthawk router from 3 years ago that reaches my TV and phone no problem. Buy elsewhere I am stuck with this piece of s..t router I am beyond upset. Another reviewer wrote about this company's lack of customer service so I will avoid at all costs. ZERO STARS
customer_reviews.author: Fred Gonzalez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good broadcast range.
customer_reviews.text: This router was expensive but good. It reaches the far corners of our large house. I like the security features, like being able to not broadcast our network name. The latest 3rd band is not of much use to me since I have no equipment that uses that band.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Futureproof
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this router. I honestly don't even have the energy to explain how much I love it. Coming from a nerd who loves to talk that's saying a lot. This is a phenomenal router however. You should get this if you're the "futureproof" type of person.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rhine

customer_reviews.title: IT of the house seems to approve
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been an IT for 9 years and he can't stop talking about how amazing this router is. I don't know much about computers but it seems to work well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've tried to trouble shoot it and have made the changes that have been recommended online (cloning one of my computer's IP addresses
customer_reviews.text: Constantly "falling offline." Always having to go and reset it in order to get back online. I've tried to trouble shoot it and have made the changes that have been recommended online (cloning one of my computer's IP addresses...) But nothing seems to work. Too complex for the average user.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen for truth

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, super stable and fast connection. I bought it because my TP-LINK smart bulbs kept getting disconnected from Alexa using my Comcast modem/wifi, but this resolved it.
customer_reviews.author: Champ

customer_reviews.title: I have had this device for about a week. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this device for about a week. I need 24/7/365 performance from my network. Before this, I had a NETGEAR AC5300 which was a total joke. This unit delivers. So far I am impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cowticket

customer_reviews.title: Powerfully fast
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it has a big footprint. But it is powerfully fast. I have full internet speed on WiFi throughout my house. Set up was quick & easy. Management is also easy using web application and iOS app.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect $300 router to stop getting updates since 2017
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router for $300, thinking this is a trusted brand. But didn't know tplink is not good with updates, even if there are issues with routers. Tplink major routers didn't got updates since 2016/2017. Finally need to switch to Netgear...
customer_reviews.author: Prabhjot Singh

customer_reviews.title: Unit works well but did not give me the area ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well but did not give me the area of coverage in my home that I hoped it would
customer_reviews.author: Ministerdave

customer_reviews.title: For the money it wasn’t muxh better than my AC1900
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning the product. For the money it wasn’t muxh better than my AC1900.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router! I don't use the AD band yet but it's nice to know it is there. Took awhile to configure IPV6 to work with Comcast but it is possible. With this unit's 9 antennas I was able to get rid of a WiFi repeater down stairs. The range on this unit is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Connected over 10 devices (5 phones, 2 laptops, ...
customer_reviews.text: Connected over 10 devices (5 phones, 2 laptops, 1 gaming pc, 1printer, 1 smartTV) I still get over 100mbph play overwatch at 10ping 🔥🔥🔥
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great speed, no range
customer_reviews.text: Super fast wifi, however the range is not very good. The Nighthawk has better range but is slower. My son was able to connect and stream in his room with the nighthawk and there is no signal in his room now. I’m now buying a repeater.
customer_reviews.author: CS Kranson

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable and great coverage
customer_reviews.text: Reliable Great coverage Great speeds Best home router money will buy
customer_reviews.author: Bilal Mahmood

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use. Sends a great signal throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic WI-FI!
customer_reviews.text: It is a FANTASTIC devise. Of the several I have gotten, this is absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.author: TLAK

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, much better wireless reception!
customer_reviews.text: Reliable, high speed performance. Has way more features than I need for my home network. Really like having more wireless channels available for PC and other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty-reaches every corner of my 6000 square foot building and even stays connected outside
customer_reviews.author: Avid

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Love this router. First tp-link router. It has less feature than other routers. It works great
customer_reviews.author: Parul Patel

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Signal strength ok, but does not keep connected equipment connected to Internet, geek squad couldn't even get it to work right
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the looks
customer_reviews.text: Love the looks. Running fiber optic line. This router keeps up with 3 Xbox1s, streaming Netflix while supporting 5 cell phones and a few other mobile devices!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Super fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Fantastic router. The Best I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, Horrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: Connected TP-Link AD7200 as recommended in the set-up guide. Only laptop and phone connected wirelessly. Printers and other devices (IoT) and direct connect (Sonos network etc wouldn't work). Called customer service (several times each day over three days - waited for hours online - always caller #6). Found back door to email support. Was told there was a problem with the call-in number. They would fix it, no date given. Would only receive email response to questions overnight (must be based overseas). 24 hours for each recommended solution. Last recommendation shut down all internet through the router. Thanks to great customer service from Amazon am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tarcoola

customer_reviews.title: You won't  be sorry you purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is fast!! Have owned several router over the years but this is a quantum leap. Very simple to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Support need improvement on request waiting time...
customer_reviews.text: Its maybe a great device but waiting for support request 3 days! - I Have a problem to connect my 1 year old IPTV Player DUNE HD TV 102 that for some reason do not see this router - Returned and exchanged with ASUS RT-AC5300 - This is a device that I can call: Technology tomorrow Today!!!
customer_reviews.author: Artur

customer_reviews.title: Great range and easy GUI layout for it's settings
customer_reviews.text: Great range and easy GUI layout for it's settings. However for some reason when I try to broadcast to Twitch, it will lose its internet connection around the 1hr 20m mark and must be restarted.
customer_reviews.author: Kaash

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best router I have EVER purchased. IT has worked flawlessly since purchased. That is rare with routers. This was a great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex P from FL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router!
customer_reviews.text: Solid router with great coverage and performance. It seems to max out around 50 connected devices but 2.4G and 5G speeds are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Gene M

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AD7200 tri band
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, greatly extended my range and super fast.
customer_reviews.author: aspro

customer_reviews.title: Powerful. Reliable. Your kids will thank you.
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the routers I have purchased through over 30 years, this is my favorite one. It’s so powerful and my kids love it. They always comment how strong the connection is no matter what room they are in.
customer_reviews.author: ChingLin

customer_reviews.title: Horrible performance
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Wi-Fi slower than a 7 year router we replaced it with, and cannot keep up even on LAN with our 230Mbps connection. On LAN with CAT6 the whole way I get max 160Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: failed after 6 months of use. not sure if power source surged or what.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Whatley

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but the range is not near what my Apple Airport Extreme was.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Blue

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link AD7200
customer_reviews.text: Great WIFI router with awesome range. Easily handles multiple devices, takes up a bit of space, but can be wall mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Fast and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless router. Covers 4000 sq ft in my old brick building.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding router. Works excellent at my home streaming 4K media and other wireless devices. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CZ Trader

customer_reviews.title: Terrible router. Inconsistent wireless signal
customer_reviews.text: Terrible router. Inconsistent wireless signal. I returned it after trying to get it to work for 30 days (in multiple locations in my house).
customer_reviews.author: Dwight D Baylor

customer_reviews.title: No regrets...
customer_reviews.text: This Router solved all of my problems with connectivity in my house. No more issues with dead spots or weak signals downstairs. I would probably have been ok with the 5200 but I was getting frustrated with exchanging routers , went thru two other brand name models before this TP-link. Also very good speeds but you will not be able to use all of the bands as not many devices are compatible with the last band. Oh and one day shipping with Amazon prime and extended factory warranty! Icing on the cake!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, easy install, great performance,shipping was super-fast. Price was excellent. 100% satisfied. Excellent Purchase! My wireless is now about 20X faster than with the D-link router I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Xoom Pen

customer_reviews.title: Th eTP Link featured the AD band but there are no devices to use that band yet so it is a wasted feature. The Router is expensiv
customer_reviews.text: Not ready yet. I hardware issues where the wifI would stop. Software updates did not help and had to return it for the ASUS RT-AC5300. Th eTP Link featured the AD band but there are no devices to use that band yet so it is a wasted feature. The Router is expensive and the UI is not user friendly. I really liked it at first but had too many problems and even though I am tech savvy I finally gave up. Maybe in a year or 2 when AD band width is usable I will return. Take your chances.
customer_reviews.author: dafaaz

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reliability.........Fast...."When it stays connected to internet"
customer_reviews.text: I have this router hard wire connected to my cable modem. My pc is hard wired to the router. I have 3 wireless devices connected. My only problem is that randomly, sometimes several times a day, the router drops internet connection and requires a power reset to get back online. Hoping for a firmware update to fix this, or I fuess I try to sell it and go back to Netgear products.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible piece of equipment. It's blazingly fast and has good configuration options. I turned on QoS and had a great improvement on streaming through my Roku. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: My Name

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: If you have an Apple product, DO NOT buy this! I replaced my old Apple Airport Extreme and when I started the TP-Link, I could not connect to my Kuna security cameras at my back door and front door. I switched back to the Airport and voila, I could easily connect to cameras and other devices (9) in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Price

customer_reviews.title: Bad for IPTV
customer_reviews.text: I switched out my R8000 for this and my IPTV was buffering all over the place. If you're a heavy IPTV user, hold off on purchasing until they smarten up the firmware like Netgear did.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Lovegrove

customer_reviews.title: Firewall issues with this router.
customer_reviews.text: Firmware firewall issues, my cable modem ISP speed is 250mb/s but the router limit speed to 10mb/s. To fix this problem I had to factory reset the router and reconfigure, then it can transfer speed to 250mb/s. However, if power is out or reboot the router, it would go back to 10mb/s. It's a bug must fix.
customer_reviews.author: KLQN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware, pity no open source support
customer_reviews.text: After a brief period of client device reconfiguration, I certify this is a very satisfying wireless router! The 2.4ghz and 5ghz radios penetrate plaster wall construction incredibly well, and the router was able to WDS bridge an old Linksys E2000 wireless routers' 2.4ghz band.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Rion

customer_reviews.title: 5GHz dropping out
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be ok however I am experiencing a drop with the 5GHz to where my devices that are connected can no longer gain outside access.
customer_reviews.author: D. Best

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I SAID WOW WOW TP-LINK AD7200 WIRELESS WI-FI IS VERY FASTEST SPEED THAN AC.
customer_reviews.author: ADRIAN MARTIN QUINN

customer_reviews.title: Okay router probably over priced.
customer_reviews.text: It works okay. I can't say that it improved my range or speed over my old Netgear AC router. The 60ghz band is pretty much useless right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and covers my 4500 sq ft ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today. It was easy to set up and covers my 4500 sq ft house very well. It is definitely one of the best router's I have ever owned. I would recommend this to anyone. If you can spend the money, this is the router for you.
customer_reviews.author: Josim9

customer_reviews.title: Worked as well or better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: Worked as well or better than I thought it would. I did not have much experience using routers beforehand. This router is working very well in connecting my Samsung LED Smart TV to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D.

customer_reviews.title: Better power, but cost-cutting dampens my enthusiasm.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to improve the connection between it and my TiVo streaming device, but found that instructions were minimal unless going online. I think this is wrong, because it presumes that the setup will be successful before one discovers how to install the device properly. That's like having to bake the cake before you get the recipe. Unfortunately, this practice seems to be a trend lately, probably justified by thoughts of cost savings and keeping the planet green, nonetheless, it detracts from the value of this relatively expensive router in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Missoula woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well until it don't keeps cutting out. I will get it
customer_reviews.author: daniel w miller

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: It is incompatible with Time Machine, according to customer support at TP-Link, despite the information I found on the internet saying it was.
customer_reviews.author: R. Unterseher

customer_reviews.title: Review coming very soon on This beast of a router !
customer_reviews.text: One look at this beast in its box made me say WOW! One thing for sure is that this router Is humongous and can't be hidden in tiny place ! This is the first router that I bought from TP link and I will write an updated review in a few weeks. So far so good, this is basically a a router that would be perfect for the Serious gamer who wants a modem that really rocks. I have only had the motor for very short time so I will send or update this review a few weeks. I hope Informed you ? 😊😊😊😊
customer_reviews.author: JOE DOE

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying the fastest speeds on 40+ devices
customer_reviews.text: This router is truly a step above and ahead the rest; I don't have any products that can take advantage of its new 60GHz band yet, but it handles all my network traffic (40+ devices) like a champ - enjoying the full 500mbps on every device that is capable of it. Surprisingly, I'm getting faster internet on my Apple TVs via wifi than if they were plugged in directly! Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Segal

customer_reviews.title: WAN disconnects confirmed
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm that as others have noted that there are random WAN disconnects that drop internet connectivity (wired and wireless) and do not automatically recover requiring either a soft restart or power cycle. Because the router is excellent otherwise, distance, coverage, and capabilities I would have given it a 5-star. Sadly, there hasn't been a firmware release that addresses this issue and until then I continue to be annoyed at several disconnects throughout the day leaving me with an opinion that I will unlikely buy another TP-Link product and eventually decide to scrap and replace. Firmware: 1.0.10 Build 20160902 rel.57400
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of TP-Link AD7200 Router
customer_reviews.text: Review of TP-Link AD7200. This product has been the worst wireless router I have ever had the misfortune to configure and use. I purchased this device Nov 26th and have yet to get it to hold a cosistant wireless connection on either 2.4 or 5ghz. The wired portion of the router works fine but I have been forced to hookup an old wireless router just so we can have some cosistancy for phones, tablets and laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Duzy 0341

customer_reviews.title: AD7200
customer_reviews.text: AD7200: bought one and when i try toset it no wifi password at the back of the router! Et up could have easy as my laptop immediately able to see it but unable to connect because of absent password! How could tp link ship it without a password! Call support who speak with an accent and had a hard time understanding what she is saying and after more than an hour i have a headache and still not connected so i just told her its ok which is not.
customer_reviews.author: George G.

customer_reviews.title: Superb.
customer_reviews.text: This router is expensive, no doubt. That being said, this is the best router I have ever owned. I recommend I to everyone. I truly believe it is the best on the market right now. I love to have fast internet and this router provides it and more. It reaches all over my apartment and across the street. It also has a great app. I think you will love this router.
customer_reviews.author: AGo

customer_reviews.title: LAN disconnects
customer_reviews.text: The Wi-Fi speeds are very fast. However, my LAN wired connections to my computer, TIVO, and ROKU frequent disconnect randomly and then don't reconnect. Wi-Fi will continue to work even though the LAN connections are not working. The only way to fix this is to reboot the router. Rebooting the computer, TIVO, and ROKU don't fix the issue. I do have the latest firmware 1.0.10 from their website installed. I hope this is something fixable via a future firmware update as I otherwise really like the router.
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: I have a 500 gb system This works perfect No lag No jams pure WI-FI
customer_reviews.text: I have a 500 gb system This works perfect No lag No jams pure WI-FI
customer_reviews.author: j

product_meta.title: TP-Link AD7200 Wireless Wi-Fi Tri-Band Gigabit Router (Talon AD7200)
product_meta.description: The AD7200 Multi-band Router delivers far-reaching and ultra-fast in-room wireless connections with the latest, most powerful generation of Wi-Fi. Stream full-length movies in minutes, send thousands of photos, and instantly share files on the new, in-room 60GHz (4600Mbps) band, while 2.4GHz (800Mbps) and 5GHz (1733Mbps) provide far-reaching Wi-Fi. Connect all your devices without slowing down and keep your network incredibly smooth using MU-MIMO, which gives up to 3x greater performance while gaming and streaming on multiple devices. Enjoy non-stop entertainment and high-speed connections thanks to a powerful 1.4GHz dual-core processor. Maximize device performance with beamforming, which delivers stronger, targeted signal.
feature_bullets: Connect every device on an incredibly smooth network with complete, ultra fast in room coverage using 802.11ad, the latest, most powerful innovation in wireless technology
Stream a 4K movie in minutes, and instantly share thousands of files and photos on the 60 GigaHertz band
AD7200 Multi band with 4 Stream technology delivers up to 7200Mbps WiFi speeds over 2.4 GigaHertz (800Mbps), 5 GigaHertz(1733Mbps), and 60 GigaHertz (4600Mbps) bands
Faster WiFi for every device with multi user support from MU MIMO technology
Enjoy high speed connections without interruption with powerful 1.4 GigaHertz dual core CPU
